Neorama: A panorama of the interior of a building, seen from within.
Novum: A game at dice, properly called novem quinque (L., nine five), the two principal throws being nine and five.
Namby-pamby: Affectedly pretty; weakly sentimental; finical; insipid.
Nuisance: That which annoys or gives trouble and vexation; that which is offensive or noxious.
Neuropathic: Of or pertaining to neuropathy; of the nature of, or suffering from, nervous disease.
Napiform: Turnip-shaped; large and round in the upper part, and very slender below.
nonadsorbent: lacking capacity to adsorb or cause to accumulate on a surface.  Opposite of adsorbent.
Nowed: Knotted; tied in a knot, as a serpent.
neighbour: Same as neighbor, neighboring, neighborhood, neighborly.
Neighborhood: The quality or condition of being a neighbor; the state of being or dwelling near; proximity.
Navigation: The act of navigating; the act of passing on water in ships or other vessels; the state of being navigable.
nephrite: A hard compact mineral, of a dark green color, formerly worn as a remedy for diseases of the kidneys, whence its name; kidney stone; a kind of jade.  It varies in color from white to dark green.  It is the more common and less valuable variety of jade, the other being jadeite.  Large deposits are found in Australia.  Called also nephritic stone.  See also Jade.
Nonsense: That which is not sense, or has no sense; words, or language, which have no meaning, or which convey no intelligible ideas; absurdity.
Nitrite: A salt or ester of nitrous acid; a compound bearing the -NO2 radical.
nameko: one of the most important fungi (Pholiota nameko) cultivated in Japan.
&Verbar;N\u00e9v\u00e9: The upper part of a glacier, above the limit of perpetual snow. See Glacier.
Nuclein: A constituent of the nuclei of all cells, containing protein and nucleic acid.  It is a colorless amorphous substance, readily soluble in alkaline fluids and especially characterized by its comparatively large content of phosphorus.  It also contains nitrogen and sulphur.
networklike: having a network of veins or ribs.
Novercal: Of or pertaining to a stepmother; suitable to, or in the manner of, a stepmother.
Natchnee: An annual grass (Eleusine coracona), cultivated in India as a food plant.
Noble-minded: Having a noble mind; of high moral or intellectual character; honorable; magnanimous.
Noncondensible: Not condensible; incapable of being liquefied; -- said of gases.
Noil: A short or waste piece or knot of wool separated from the longer staple by combing; also, a similar piece or shred of waste silk.
newsroom: A room where news is collected and disseminated, located in the offices of a newspaper, magazine, or news broadcast organization; as, the CBS newsroom.
Neurotomy: The dissection, or anatomy, of the nervous system.
&Verbar;Nymph\u00e6a: A genus of aquatic plants having showy flowers (white, blue, pink, or yellow, often fragrant), including the white water lily and the Egyptia lotus.
Neurotome: An instrument for cutting or dissecting nerves.
Natch: The rump of beef; esp., the lower and back part of the rump.
Neuration: The arrangement or distribution of nerves, as in the leaves of a plant or the wings of an insect; nervation; venation.
Noctambulation: Somnambulism; sleepwalking; walking in one's sleep.
Norfolk spaniel: One of a breed of field spaniels similar to the clumbers, but shorter in body and of a liver-and-white or black-and-white color.
Near-legged: Having the feet so near together that they interfere in traveling.
&Verbar;Necrosis: The pathologic death of part of a tissue due to irreversible damage.    Contrast to necrobiosis, which is a normal death of cells in a tissue.  Formerly, applied primarily to death of bone tissue.
&Verbar;Nisus: A striving; an effort; a conatus.
Nether: Situated down or below; lying beneath, or in the lower part; having a lower position; belonging to the region below; lower; under; -- opposed to upper.
Nonjoinder: The omission of some person who ought to have been made a plaintiff or defendant in a suit, or of some cause of action which ought to be joined.
&Verbar;Nolle prosequi: Will not prosecute; -- an entry on the record, denoting that a plaintiff discontinues his suit, or the attorney for the public a prosecution; either wholly, or as to some count, or as to some of several defendants.
no-nonsense: Not tolerating irrelevant or frivolous distractions; businesslike; serious; as, the no-nonsense tones of a stern parent; the chairman adopted a no-nonsense attitude.
Neology: The introduction of a new word, or of words or significations, into a language; as, the present nomenclature of chemistry is a remarkable instance of neology.
Non-Episcopal: Not Episcopal; not pertaining to the Episcopal church or system.
Negress: A black woman; a female negro.
Ninepence: An old English silver coin, worth nine pence.
Nainsook: A thick sort of jaconet muslin, plain or striped, formerly made in India.
&Verbar;Neurula: An embryo of certain invertebrates in the stage when the primitive band is first developed.
Nonslaveholding: Not possessing or holding slaves; as, a nonslaveholding State.
NNE: north northeast; the compass point that is midway between north and northeast.
Nitrobenzene: A yellow aromatic liquid (C6H5.NO2), produced by the action of nitric acid on benzene, and called from its odor imitation oil of bitter almonds, or essence of mirbane.  It is used in perfumery, and is manufactured in large quantities in the preparation of aniline.  Fornerly called also nitrobenzol.
Notification: The act of notifying, or giving notice; the act of making known; especially, the act of giving official notice or information to the public or to individuals, corporations, companies, or societies, by words, by writing, or by other means.
NNW: north northwest; the compass point that is midway between north and northwest.
Nipponese: Of or relating to or characteristic of Japan or its people or their culture or language; Japanese.
Nucleole: The nucleus within a nucleus; nucleolus.
Nasolachrymal: Connected with the lachrymal apparatus and the nose; as, the nasolachrymal, or lachrymal duct.
nano-: A prefix meaning one-billionth; as, a nanogram is one-thousandth of a microgram.
Newspaper: A sheet of paper printed and distributed, at stated intervals, for conveying intelligence of passing events, advocating opinions, etc.; a public print that circulates news, advertisements, proceedings of legislative bodies, public announcements, etc.
nanotechnology: The manipulation or construction of objects with sizes in the nanometer range or smaller.
Numeric: Any number, proper or improper fraction, or incommensurable ratio. The term also includes any imaginary expression like m + n√-1, where m and n are real numerics.
nonfunctional: Not having or performing a function.
Neighborliness: The quality or state of being neighborly.
nondiscrimination: Fairness in treating people without prejudice; -- used mostly in reference to discrimination based on race, religion, and nationality.
newsworthy: Sufficiently interesting to be reported in a newspaper; as, a dog biting a man is not a newsworthy item.
Ningishzida: A Babylonian underworld deity, the patron of medicine.
Nonmembership: State of not being a member.
&Verbar;Nasion: The middle point of the nasofrontal suture.
-nik: A suffix attached to other words indicating a person with certain characteristics or associated with a certain group or behavior; as, beatnik, kibbutznik; it is sometimes used derogatorily; as in no-goodnik, peacenik.
Nonjuror: One of those adherents of James II. who refused to take the oath of allegiance to William and Mary, or to their successors, after the revolution of 1688; a Jacobite.
Nowhither: Not anywhither; in no direction; nowhere.
Nonregent: A master of arts whose regency has ceased. See Regent.
Necronite: Fetid feldspar, a mineral which, when struck, exhales a fetid odor.
Noropianic: Of, pertaining to, or designating, an acid of the aromatic series obtained from opianic acid.
Naphthalenic: Pertaining to , or derived from, naphthalene; -- used specifically to designate a yellow crystalline substance, called naphthalenic acid and also hydroxy quinone, and obtained from certain derivatives of naphthol.
Nakedly: In a naked manner; without covering or disguise; manifestly; simply; barely.
Natatorial: Inclined or adapted to swim; swimming; as, natatorial birds.
Nascent: Commencing, or in process of development; beginning to exist or to grow; coming into being; as, a nascent germ.
Newfoundland: An island on the coast of British North America, famed for the fishing grounds in its vicinity.
narrate: To tell, rehearse, or recite, as a story; to relate the particulars of; to go through with in detail, as an incident or transaction; to give an account of.
Nodosity: The quality of being knotty or nodose; resemblance to a node or swelling; knottiness.
nonverbal: Involving little or no use of language; as, gestures are a form of nonverbal communication.
nightclub: An establishment providing entertainment (as singers, dancers, or comedy acts), usually open late into the night or early morning, typically serving alcoholic beverages and food.
Nonjurorism: The doctrines, or action, of the Nonjurors.
Novosibirsk: A city in the Asian part of Russia.  Much Soviet military research was performed there, and until the 1990's it was restricted from entry by foreigners.
Neodymium: The chemical element of atomic number 60, one of the rare earth elements.  Symbol Nd.  Atomic weight 144.27.
&Verbar;Notopodium: The dorsal lobe or branch of a parapodium. See Parapodium.
Nerka: The most important salmon of Alaska (Oncorhinchus nerka), ascending in spring most rivers and lakes from Alaska to Oregon, Washington, and Idaho; -- called also red salmon, redfish, blueback, and sawqui.
nonprehensile: not prehensile; as, cats have a nonprehensile tail.  Opposite of prehensile.
Nomic: Customary; ordinary; -- applied to the usual English spelling, in distinction from strictly phonetic methods.
&Verbar;Nautch: An entertainment consisting chiefly of dancing by professional dancing (or Nautch) girls.
North-Central: Of or pertaining to a region of the U. S. generally including states of the upper Mississippi valley and Great Lakes region lying north of the Ohio River and the southern boundaries of Kansas and Missouri and between the western boundary of Pennsylvania and the eastern boundaries of Montana; Wyoming; and Colorado.
Negligent: Apt to neglect; customarily neglectful; characterized by negligence; careless; heedless; culpably careless; showing lack of attention; as, disposed in negligent order.
networking: Interchanging information or services, among a group; -- of persons or organizations.
Needlebook: A book-shaped needlecase, having leaves of cloth into which the needles are stuck.
Narceine: An alkaloid found in small quantities in opium, and extracted as a white crystalline substance of a bitter astringent taste.  It is a narcotic.  Called also narceia.
November: The eleventh month of the year, containing thirty days.
Narcotism: Narcosis; the state of being narcotized.
Nasicornous: Bearing a horn, or horns, on the nose, as the rhinoceros.
Nitryl: A name sometimes given to the nitro group or radical.
Nounal: Of or pertaining to a noun.
Nonusance: Neglect of using; failure to use.
night-stop: A pause during a journey, to rest for the night.
Noctivagant: Going about in the night; night-wandering.
Natural product chemistry: That branch of chemistry which deals with the isolation, identification, structure elucidation, and study of the chemical characteristics of chemical substances produced by living organisms.
Naturalness: The state or quality of being natural; conformity to nature.
Neurology: The branch of science which treats of the nervous system.
nervine: Having the quality of acting upon or affecting the nerves; quieting nervous excitement.
Nearsightedness: An  eyesight abnormality resulting from the eye's faulty refractive ability, such that one can see only close objects distinctly; the condition of being nearsighted.  See Myopic, and Myopia.
&Verbar;Nero-antico: A beautiful black marble found in fragments among Roman ruins, and usually thought to have come from ancient Laconia.
nuclear power: Power derived from nuclear reactions; -- used at present especially of electrical power generated in atomic reactors, but encompassing also fusion power.
Nonane: One of a group of metameric hydrocarbons C9H20 of the paraffin series; -- so called because of the nine carbon atoms in the molecule. Normal nonane is a colorless volatile liquid, an ingredient of ordinary kerosene.
nursed: fed mother's milk from the breast; -- of an infant.
Never: Not ever; not at any time; at no time, whether past, present, or future.
Noninflectional: Not admitting of, or characterized by, inflection.
Nuchal: Of, pertaining to, or in the region of, the back, or nape, of the neck; -- applied especially to the anterior median plate in the carapace of turtles.
Nullify: To make void; to render invalid; to deprive of legal force or efficacy.
Neven: To name; to mention; to utter.
Nineteen: The number greater than eighteen by a unit; the sum of ten and nine; nineteen units or objects.
Nutritive: Of or pertaining to nutrition; as, the nutritive functions; having the quality of nourishing; nutritious; nutrimental; alimental; as, nutritive food or berries.
Nymphlike: Resembling, or characteristic of, a nymph.
Nol-pros: To discontinue by entering a nolle prosequi; to decline to prosecute.
Nightshirt: A kind of nightgown for men.
Night Before Christmas: The popular name for a poem by Clement Clarke Moore titled A Visit from St. Nicholas, a popular poem with the theme of St. Nicholas (Santa Claus) coming to bring gifts to children on Christmans eve.
Nitrocalcite: Nitrate of calcium, a substance having a grayish white color, occuring in efflorescences on old walls, and in limestone caves, especially where there exists decaying animal matter.
&Verbar;Nephridium: A segmental tubule; one of the tubules of the primitive urinogenital organs; a segmental organ. See Illust. under Loeven's larva.
Nona\u00ebrobiotic: Capable of living without atmospheric oxygen; anaërobiotic.
nitrobacteria: Soil bacteria that convert nitrites to nitrates.
Nephrology: A treatise on, or the science which treats of, the kidneys, and their structure and functions.
Nuncupate: To declare publicly or solemnly; to proclaim formally.
Napaea: A genus consisting of only one species, the glade mallow.
Nemertean: Of or pertaining to the Nemertina.
Nomarch: The chief magistrate of a nome or nomarchy.
Nonsane: Unsound; not perfect; as, a person of nonsane memory.
Nonexistence: The state of not existing; absence of existence; the negation of being; -- usually used with reference to existince in the real world, or logical possiblity; as, the nonexistence of vaporware does not go unnoticed long.
Nonone: Any one of several metameric unsaturated hydrocarbons (C9H14) of the valylene series.
